author: guitargeek
body:
Hi all,

while waiting for my other PR https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/pull/24432 to get tested, I checked out a bit the `PFEGammaAlgo`, since I heard from colleagues that it's so hard to understand that it's slowing physics object studies down.

Anyway, I noticed it relies a lot on `std::unary_function` and `std::binary_function`, which are deprecated since C++11 and out of the standard since C++17. Maybe we don't want to use them anymore? I removed a big chunk of them from the code, refactoring a bit on the way.

It was really interesting since I learned how to use `std::bind`, `std::function` and the lambda expressions in practice.

Local matrix tests pass, there should be absolutely no difference in reconstruction.
title: Removed many unary_/binary_functions
